snippet: While the earthquake and tsunami in Japan killed about 20,000 people, radiation from the nuclear plant has not killed anyone so far, and experts suggest that the doses were too small to have much effect.
abstract: While the earthquake and tsunami in Japan killed about 20,000 people, radiation from the nuclear plant has not killed anyone so far, and experts suggest that the doses were too small to have much effect.

headline.main: Sizing Up Health Impacts a Year After Fukushima
